intro: Gauropsis canescens, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Gauropsis canescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
